column4: Sony Vaio Pentium 4-1500 CPU, 256MB of PC-133 SDRAM <------------------------- Can this handle Ubuntu???
the specs are fine for plain Ubuntu, Xubuntu might swap less
what do yo mean by "awn"?
the original gOS was light weight, then they went heavy, and I think they're going light again in a future release
AWM = Avant Window Navigator, the fancy dock bar in gOS
if it had 512 or more memory, I'd use straight Ubuntu
if you can't get more memory, Xubuntu will run faster
well I don't have any extra ram for this pc (except for pc100 stick but it uses pc133) so it will have to stay with 256.  Would you go Xubuntu over gOs?
yes, like I said, recent gOS releases haven't been any lighter than standard Ubuntu
xubuntu would work fine
you can use just a lightweight window manager like Fluxbox, but at a sacrifice of quite a bit of functionality
what ages are the intended users?
I believe the kids and the mom will use it mostly.  The girls are pretty smart, aged 10 and 12
You can look at Qimo: www.qimo4kids.com but they're at the upper-end of it's targetted age range
disclaimer: I'm the developer of Qimo, so I'm biased
what comes with it?  Open office?  chat client?
does it have pidgin or chat client built in?
it has pidgin and xchat
i may download and try in virtualbox first.  Thanks
leave any feedback you have, it's a 1.0 release, so we're looking for ways to improve it
did you try Qimo?

yes, and it looks really good for the younger set.....like some of my nieces and nephews.  However these girls a getting older next year grade 8 and grade 6 so I opted for full xubuntu. But will consider qimo in the future for younger set.
you're a part of freegeek?
freegeek is an organization that recycles old computers by putting Linux on them and giving them back out in their communities
